attributes.comment:
I am a single mom who recently adopted a son from Vietnam. And I am in the
process again to adopt a sibling for him. The proposed USCIS fee increase on
docket USCIS-2006- 0044 really puts a strain on adoptive parents. The process to
adopt internationally is very expensive, difficult and time consuming. The fees
already paid to USCIS are high enough. Many families are looking at a long
process ahead and the possibility of having to renew fingerprints and pay the fees
again for the same adoption. Not only should the fees not increase, but the length
of time the 171H is valid should be lengthened.
Please consider that most of the families adopting are stretched to the limit
financially to bring their children home and keep fees more reasonable for everyone.
Thank you so much for your consideration.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Melynda J Miller
